categories.name: Baked Goods, Prepared Foods, and Immediate Consumption
Jams, Jellies, and Shelf Stable Food
Meats, Eggs, Dairy Products, and Seafood

entries.name: Baked goods (home kitchen)
entries.regulation: Follow labeling requirements (listed below). Note that breads with cheese baked in/on them require testing to determine their category (see testing table below).

entries.name: Icing with >65% sugar
entries.regulation: If the icing is known to contain >65% sugar, testing and licensing is not needed. Otherwise, testing and possibly licensing is required (see testing table).

entries.name: Dry baking mixes
entries.regulation: Follow labeling requirements (listed below)

entries.name: Fresh (or dried) uncut fruits,  vegetables, or herbs (not cut beyond normal harvesting)
entries.regulation: May be home grown; any pesticide use must comply with label directions.

entries.name: Intact salad greens (not cut beyond normal harvesting)
entries.regulation: Follow weights and measures requirements. Note that all sprouts and any greens cut beyond normal harvesting require a license.

entries.name: Certain cut produce and cut herbs (other than cut tomatoes, melons, or leafy greens)
entries.regulation: If product is blanched before freezing and has a pH above 4.2, licensing is required for frozen foods. If not blanched first, no licensing required.

entries.name: Nuts and nut butters
entries.regulation: May be sold shelled or in shell. Peanut and other nut butters can also be sold direct to consumer without licensing.

entries.name: Honey
entries.regulation: Can sell direct to consumer without licensing. Note that sales of packaged honey to grocery stores (including consignment sales) for resale or sales by an individual that did not package the honey requires a KDA Food Processors License.

entries.name: Poultry < 20,000 birds/year)
entries.regulation: Growers raising fewer than 1,000 birds/year can slaughter and sell direct to consumer their own birds at their own facility without registration or inspection. Growers selling 1,001 to 20,000 birds/year must register their exemption from inspection with KDA (at no cost). More details available in https://agriculture.ks.gov/docs/default source/rc meat and poultry/mp 19 m p registration application.pdf

entries.name: Eggs (< 250 hens)
entries.regulation: Should be sold at <45F. Cartons should be clean and labeled properly. (Temperature control and labeling strongly suggested for establishments with fewer than 50 hens; temperature control and labeling required for farms with 51 to 249 hens, must be ungraded. Licensing (and grading) required with > 249 hens or if selling graded eggs.)

entries.name: Home canned fruit jams and jellies; jams and jellies flavored with pepper flavored vinegar or small amounts of pepper powder
entries.regulation: Must follow labeling requirements.

entries.name: Home canned fruit jams and jellies; jams and jellies flavored with pepper flavored vinegar or small amounts of pepper powder
entries.regulation: Must follow labeling requirements.

entries.name: Juice, cider
entries.regulation: No license required if sold packaged (served by the glass requires license.) If not pasteurized, must include a warning statement on the label (see p. 58, Kansas Food Code, https://agriculture.ks.gov/docs/default source/fsl  handouts/2012_kda_food_code_12_14_12.pdf). Can be put into bottles or jugs, but not sealed or heat filled to be exempt.

entries.name: Canned, shelf stable naturally high acid foods (and formulated acid foods)
entries.regulation: Must follow labeling requirements. Requirements for other canned foods listed below. More information on FDAs classification of canned foods, including (formulated acid) foods is available from: https://www.fda.gov/food/guidanceregulation/guidancedocumentsregulatoryinformation/acidifiedlacf/default.htm

entries.name: Candies (made in home kitch en)
entries.regulation: Note: homemade chocolates must be tested to determine if license is needed (see testing table on page 5).

entries.name: Cultivated mushrooms (culinary and medicinal)
entries.regulation: Note the regulations listed below for wild mushrooms.

entries.name: Fish and seafood, sold whole on ice (does NOT include catfish and other Siluriformes)
entries.regulation: No HACCP plan or processing license required. Note that wild caught fish sales are illegal without a commercial fishing permit from Kansas Department of Wildlife, Parks and Tourism. See K.S.A. 115 17 10 and 115 17 13 for more information.

entries.name: Cultivated mushrooms (culinary and medicinal)
entries.regulation: Note the regulations listed below for wild mushrooms.

entries.name: Foods and beverages prepared off site, sold ready for immedi ate consumption (six or fewer times per calendar year.)
entries.regulation: No licensing required; however, must follow (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments). No licensing required; however, must follow Kansas Administrative Regulations (KAR) 4 28 33 (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments). More details also in KAR 4 28 34 (Exemption from licensure; definitions). Note that this would also include cooking classes and competitions, such as BBQ competitions.

entries.name: Foods and beverages sold ready for immediate consumption by community groups for fundraising purposes
entries.regulation: No licensing required; however, must follow (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments). Fundraising for community or humanitarian purposes and educational or youth activities is exempt from licensing with no restriction on number of times done per year.

entries.name: Foods and beverages prepared off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or fewer times per calendar year.)
entries.regulation: No licensing required; however, must follow (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments). Fundraising for community or humanitarian purposes and educational or youth activities is exempt from licensing with no restriction on number of times done per year.

entries.name: Foods and beverages prepared on or off site, sold ready for immediate consumption (six or more times per calendar year.)
entries.regulation: No licensing required; however, must follow “Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments”. Fundraising for community or humanitarian purposes and educational or youth activities is exempt from licensing with no restriction on number of times done per year.

entries.name: Non specialized processed food that is made and sold six or fewer days in a year.
entries.regulation: The food product can be made on day one and each day they are sold adds to the total of up to 6 days without a license. Must follow (Sanitation and hygiene requirements for exempt food establishments) indicated above. Products such as pesto need to be cooled quickly and held at < 41F for no more than 6 days after preparing. Note that any products that require specialized processing* require advance approval even if it is for 6 or fewer days.

entries.name: Homemade dried pasta
entries.regulation: No licensing required if dried in a protected environment in a short time period

entries.name: Vanilla extract
entries.regulation: No licensing needed if the product meets the standard of identity in 21 CFR 169.175 to ensure it is vanilla extract and not a flavored alcohol.

entries.name: Spices
entries.regulation: Product must be labeled properly, unadulterated, and sold in a sanitary manner

entries.name: Lard
entries.regulation: No licensing required if sold direct to consumer.

entries.name: Pepper vinegars
entries.regulation: RAW peppers must be used in making pepper vinegar to sell without a license

entries.name: Herb flavored/infused vinegars
entries.regulation: Unless using low acid vinegar (pH>4.2) or enough herbs included to raise equilibrium pH above 4.2, product does NOT require a license.

entries.name: Grain products
entries.regulation: Standard hygiene and sanitation requirements, as with all food sold

entries.name: Fruit leathers
entries.regulation: Standard hygiene and sanitation requirements, as with all food sold

entries.name: Sampling of food products
entries.regulation: Samples must be prepared and served in a sanitary manner. More details available in the KSRE/KDA publication MF3311 on Sampling Safely at Kansas Farmers Markets. (https://bookstore.ksre.k state.edu/pubs/MF3311.pdf)

entries.name: Dairy products; milk
entries.regulation: Pasteurized and processed at KDA licensed Dairy Manufacturing Plant; food establishment license required at point of sale. Note that if a vendor can provide information about a vacuum packaged cheese to show that it does not require refrigeration for safety (typically low water activity and low pH values), a food establishment license would NOT be required for the point of sale.

entries.name: Baked products with potentially hazardous dairy and egg  products
entries.regulation: Food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale.

entries.name: Dough
entries.regulation: Product requires temperature control for safety, so a food establish-ment license is required.

entries.name: Meat, poultry (>20,000 birds/year), and catfish (rawNote: products containing 2% or more cooked meat or poultry or more than 3% raw meat by weight are considered meat products.)
entries.regulation: Product must be processed at an inspected facility and properly labeled. Food establishment license required at point of sale unless registered as a wholesale dealer. May be sold refrigerated or frozen. Note that these products require KDA Meat and Poultry inspection for wholesale (for further distribution) sales.

entries.name: Meat, poultry, and catfish ready to eat
entries.regulation: Product must be inspected by KDA or USDA and sold at the appropriate temperature. Note that any curing of meat using nitrites requires proper licensing.

entries.name: Fish and seafood, cleaned (other than catfish)
entries.regulation: KDA food establishment or food processing license at preparation facility, Hazard Analysis, food establishment license at the point of sale. An HACCP plan is also needed if any hazards are identified as being reasonably likely to occur. Note that wild caught fish sales are illegal without a commercial fishing permit from KDWPT.

entries.name: Vacuum packaged foods requiring temperature control for safety
entries.regulation: Must follow the above listed requirements of cheese or meat products or whatever category the food is in.

entries.name: Sprouts
entries.regulation: KDA food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale.

entries.name: Cut leafy greens (fresh or dried)
entries.regulation: KDA food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale. Must be sold at or below 41F.

entries.name: Certain cut produce (fresh or dried)
entries.regulation: KDA food establishment license required at production facility and point of sale.

entries.name: Roasted vegetables
entries.regulation: Temperature control is required for safety; therefore, KDA license is required. Note that even if you are selling raw produce and providing roasting services on site, you would still need a license. Must wash before roasting.

entries.name: Wild mushrooms
entries.regulation: Mushrooms picked in the wild must be individually inspected for safety by a KDA registered mushroom identifier. More information available in the Selling Fresh Produce section.

entries.name: Naturally fermented canned foods
entries.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License required for production facility.

entries.name: Acidified shelf stable canned foods/Low acid shelf stable canned foods
entries.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License or Food Processors License required for production facility. Requires recipe approval; Better Process Control School (BPCS) required. KDA Meat and Poultry inspection required if canned meat is sold wholesale. Contact Kansas State University Value Added Foods Lab for more information on recipe approval and BPCS: www.ksre.ksu.edu/kvaf

entries.name: Foods and beverages prepared on or off site, sold ready for immediate consumption — six or more times per calendar year.
entries.regulation: If selling more than six times/year, vendor must have a KDA Food Establishment license. Note that a Food Processing License would be required for any WHOLESALE sales.

entries.name: Alcoholic beverages (>0.5% alcohol by volume)
entries.regulation: Kansas Dept. of Revenue alcohol licensing requirements. (www.ksrevenue.org/abcstatutes.html)

entries.name: Infused oils
entries.regulation: KDA Food Establishment License or Food Processors License required for production facility. If finished product is not shelf stable, food establishment license also required for point of sale.

entries.name: Animal feed/treats
entries.regulation: Kansas commercial feed license and small pet product application required. Food safety license not required (may be made in a home kitchen). Guaranteed analysis for protein, fat, and fiber, and ingredient statement required on label. (More information available from: http://agriculture.ks.gov/divisions programs/dairy inspection/feed safety/feed licenses)

entries.name: Broths
entries.regulation: If includes less than 2% meat or poultry (after cooking), KDA Food Establishment licence required (for direct to consumer sales). KDA Food processing license required if selling wholesale. If canned and sold shelf stable, follow acidified or low acid canned food requirements (see above).

entries.name: Pepper jams and jellies (canned, shelf stable, other than those described above as exempt). In cludes jellies made with pepper juice.
entries.regulation: If product is determined to have low water activity, product can be sold without a license. Otherwise, KDA license required.

entries.name: Low sugar fruit jams and jellies
entries.regulation: If product is determined to be an acid food, formulated acid, or low water activity food, no license is required. Otherwise, KDA license required.

entries.name: Low sugar fruit jams and jellies (canned, shelf stable)
entries.regulation: Depending on the pH of the final product and the main product ingredients, the product may be exempt from licensing or may be considered an acidified canned food that requires a license (see information on acidified foods in table above).

entries.name: Chocolate Candies
entries.regulation: If product is determined to require temperature control for safety in a product assessment, KDA license is required. Otherwise, no license is required.

entries.name: Pecan Pie
entries.regulation: If the filling is determined to require temperature control based on its water activity, KDA license is required. Otherwise, no license is required.

entries.name: Powdered sugar/ milk icing
entries.regulation: Often used on cinnamon rolls and similar products. If product is determined to have low water activity, product can be sold without a license. Otherwise, KDA license required. Note that if the icing is known to contain >65% sugar, testing and licensing is not needed.

entries.name: Bread with cheese baked in/on top
entries.regulation: If product is determined to have low water activity and thus not require refrigeration for safety, product can be sold without a license. Otherwise, KDA license required.

entries.name: Homemade mustard
entries.regulation: If the product is determined to have pH below 4.6 and that it can be safely stored at room temperature, product can be sold direct to consumer without a license. Otherwise, KDA license is required.

entries.name: Herb infused simple syrups, elderberry and other fruit syrups
entries.regulation: If product is determined to be a low water activity food, no license is required. Otherwise, KDA license is required.
